faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens, non-EU citizens, and foreign companies can all legally buy residential property. You'll need a Spanish Tax Identification Number (NIF) and must comply with standard conveyancing procedures. We recommend engaging a bilingual Spanish lawyer to guide you through the process and ensure all requirements are met.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, typical acquisition costs in Spain include: Transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (1-2%). For VILLAMAR TOURISTIC APARTMENTS VII in Murcia, these additional costs typically total 8-13% of the purchase price. We provide detailed cost breakdowns during the consultation process.
